ovdesc.p: This document describes the use and purpose of the ACCOUNT.CLASS table.

The standard T24 function codes (I for Input, A for Authorisation, D for Delete, etc...) are used within the ACCOUNT.CLASS Application. However, the Reverse function (function code R) is not permitted.

This table file has two types of entries. This first type (Account) provides the Category Code portion when building an Internal Account Number (such as Computer Suspense Account). The second type (Class) provides the parameters required to identify a group of accounts (e.g. under a heading like NOSTRO) by matching the account details against those held in the account class record.
When the record type is ACCOUNT then the category code must be valid and in the range 10000 to 19999.

When the record type is CLASS the category and sector code fields are treated as multi value associated fields. Either field may be null but not both at the same time. Duplications of category and sector code combined are not allowed within one entry on the ACCOUNT.CLASS table.
List of key values used
The following are the allowed key values by Type:
TYPE - ACCOUNT
Key Value Description
SUSPENSE To be used when the DATA.CAPTURE system generates suspense entries at the end of day for those entries which have not been authorised.
DIFFERENCE To be used when the DATA.CAPTURE system has to raise an entry to balance a batch as part of the end of day processing.

SUSPCREDIT/ To be used when the end of day accounting module SUSPDEBIT raises a credit/debit suspense entry as original entry can not be posted due to account not being present or override condition has been met.
SUSPLMMCR/ To be used by the Loans and Money Market SUSPLMMDR systems when the true account is not yet known for the payment entry.
SUSPFXCR/ To be used by the Foreign Exchange system when SUSPFXDR the true account is not yet known for the payment entry.
EXCHADJ To be used by the Forex system when posting the amount of unrealised profit and loss produced by the revaluation of Foreign Exchange contracts.
EXCHALFWD Used to post the P & L produced by the revaluation and contingent balances in a value dated accounting system.
RESFWDCR/ To be used by the Forex system when posting the RESFWDDR/ interest accruals on Foreign Exchange contracts RESSWAPCR/ using the straight line or Interest revaluation RESSWAPDR method.
BROKER Used to identify the provision account to be used to book the brokerage.
NETTING To be used when the NETTING sub-system generates suspense entries for transations that will have net payments.
FXCCYPOS Used when generating reserve account numbers for forward FX deals with position amortisation.
TYPE - CLASS
Key Value Description
NOSTRO Used to identify an account as being classified as a nostro account.
BRANCH Used to identify an account as belong to a branch of Company processed.
BANK Used to identify an account as belong to a Bank.
VOSTRO Used to identify an account as being classified as a vostro account.
SAVINGS Used to identify accounts which are classified as savings accounts.

desc.p: Identifies the Type of record being specified.
The value entered indicates the use of the record as follows:
ACCOUNT The record provides the category code for the internal account number.
CLASS The record provides the details for identifying a group of accounts.
P&L The record allows definition of Profit and Loss categories.
2 type AAA (alpha A-Z, a-z) values only, ACCOUNT or CLASS. (Mandatory input)

When the value is ACCOUNT then the key value must be one of the following: DIFFERENCE SUSPENSE EXCHADJ SUSPFXCR INTERCO SUSPFXDR SUSPCREDIT SUSPLMMCR SUSPDEBIT SUSPLMMDR PLCLOSE BROKER RESFWDCR RESFWDDR RESSWAPCR RESSWAPDR
When the value is P&L then the key value must be one of following: MKTEXCHCR MKTEXCHDR TTMKTEXCHCR TTMKTEXCHDR FTMKTEXCHCR FTMKTEXCHDR
The account classification will uniquely identify each ACCOUNT.CLASS entry.
Specific records on the ACCOUNT.CLASS table are used by the other applications when either an account number is to be constructed or an account is to be checked for a particular group.
11 type SSS (uppercase alpha) characters mnemonic. (Mandatory Input) Rule: The values allowed are as follows:

SUSPSCDR SUSPSCCR SCDIFF SUSPFRACR SUSPFRADR SUSPFTBULK SUSPFTINWD
SUSPPD SUSPSLCR SUSPSLDR TFLC LCAMORT LCDIFF PLCLOSE INTERCO

desc.p: or any value prefixed by U- to identify a user defined class.
Identifies the Category code part of the account number that is to be raised or the category code for the group of accounts classification.

If the RECORD TYPE (field 2) is Account then this field contains the Category code that is to be used in the account number that is to be created. If the record type is Class then this field contains the category code that is to be on an account record when the account belongs to the classification specified. If this field is null then any category code valued is allowed on the account record.
If the RECORD TYPE is P&L then this field contains the category code to which corresponding PL entries will be booked when Revaluation Credits or Debits PROFIT/LOSS.
Changes to this field for the Account Classifications RESFWDCR, RESFWDDR, RESSWAPCR and RESSWAPDR must be done by using the application FX.REVAL.PARAMETERS.
4-5 numeric character Category code. If the Account Classification is RESFWDCR, RESFWDDR, RESSWAPCR or RESSWAPDR, this field may not be changed after the record has been authorised. (Optional input)
Code entered must be on the CATEGORY table.
When the record type is ACCOUNT then the Category Code must be in the range 10000 to 19999.
When the record type is CLASS this field can be null or any valid category.
When the record type is P&L then the value must be in range 50000 - 59000. Only one value is allowed.
Describes the purpose of the ACCOUNT.CLASS record.

This field can be expanded to allow the User to enter the description of the ACCOUNT.CLASS in various languages. Each expansion of the field will correspond to a new Language as defined in the LANGUAGE Table and will indicate to the user the Language in which the Description must be entered.
3-35 type A (alphanumeric) characters. Multilanguage field. Multivalue field. Mandatory input.
When RECORD.TYPE is CLASS this is the sector code for the group of accounts classification.

If the RECORD.TYPE type is CLASS then this field contains the sector code that is to be on the customer record when the account belongs to the classification specified. If this field is null then any sector code valued is allowed on the customer record.
1-4 numeric character Sector Code. (Optional input)
When the RECORD TYPE (field 2) is ACCOUNT or P&L then this field must be null.
When the record type is CLASS then this field can be either null or a valid sector code on the SECTOR file (Ref: Customer).

When the record type is CLASS the category and sector code fields are treated as multi value associated fields. Either field may be null but not both at the same time. Duplications of category and sector code combined are not allowed.
